stem: You respond to a patient with severe dyspnea with accessory muscle use. What should you do FIRST?

choices.A: Perform a lower-priority intervention before addressing airway or circulation threats.
choices.B: Open and protect the airway, provide high-concentration oxygen, and prepare advanced airway support.
choices.C: Delay intervention until a full history is completed.
choices.D: Focus on comfort measures while deferring critical reassessment of ABC status.
choices.E: Request or perform an intervention outside routine paramedic scope in this field context.

rationale: Correct answer emphasizes NREMT-style prioritization: mental status, life threats/ABCs, chief complaint, then vitals or trends. Incorrect choices either delay care, act out of sequence, exceed scope, or ignore immediate threats.

choices.B: Perform a lower-priority intervention before addressing airway or circulation threats.
choices.C: Focus on comfort measures while deferring critical reassessment of ABC status.
choices.D: Request or perform an intervention outside routine paramedic scope in this field context.
choices.E: Delay intervention until a full history is completed.

rationale: Correct answer emphasizes NREMT-style prioritization: mental status, life threats/ABCs, chief complaint, then vitals or trends. Incorrect choices either delay care, act out of sequence, exceed scope, or ignore immediate threats.
